lexUnit.name: appropriate.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: fitting or suitable for a particular entity or event

sentence.text: These skills include advanced listening and speaking , analytical reading and writing , and a thorough awareness of ` register '' -- that is of the different types or styles of French appropriate for different situations .
Steel himself was a noted tactician , more concerned with manoeuvre than with policy-making , a style appropriate for the parliamentary situation .
` No single method of training is appropriate for all situations .
This is most appropriate for research situations where the teachers themselves are strongly motivated and committed to the research .
On 3 January , 1974 , the BBC wrote to the Musicians ' Union suggesting that the BBC reissue old material on video , with appropriate royalties for the musicians , actors and scriptwriters .

It follows from this analysis that the provision of the report to the borrower is an action by the building society and that if it is prepared without appropriate skill and care the ground of the complaint , namely breach of the society 's contractual obligation , falls within paragraph 1 ( a ) of Part III to Schedule 12 .
The capacity to understand the business and information needs of clients and to structure appropriate solutions is essential .
What evidence is there that you are not living up to the appropriate standards ?
The Panel accepts that the provisions of the City Code may not be appropriate to all such private companies and will , therefore , apply the City Code with a degree of flexibility in suitable cases .
If necessary , such a person could then be sent on a suitable training course to learn any technical skills which might seem to be appropriate .
You should select and practise the appropriate method for the task in hand .
We then calculate the appropriate reservation wages for the two periods .
The Solidarity leadership , while supporting the workers ' demands , said that the means used were not appropriate and that it could not deny the legitimacy of the government 's position .
Diagnosis may facilitate communication among professionals in obtaining an appropriate placement for a child .
The great man paced back and forth , uttering as he did so a formula of annexation appropriate to the moment :
Professor Buckley and his team will be examining ways of predicting which of the three strategies will be most appropriate to the needs and circumstances of any particular company .
